sense.name: The act of moving in a hurried manner.
sense.examples: In his rush he forgot his book. The morning rush is a hard time in the diner. The sudden rush of people surprised the attendant.

sense.name: Grasslike plants growing in wet places.
sense.examples: The marsh is filled with rush.

sense.name: Benjamin Rush, physician and American Revolutionary leader.
sense.examples: Many people followed Rush. Rush led the way to victory.

sense.name: An upwelling of emotion.
sense.examples: He gets a rush out of driving fast. What a rush! She has a quick rush from injecting heroin.

sense.name: (American football) an attempt to advance the ball by running into the line.
sense.examples: The linebackers were ready to stop a rush. Coach tried a rush before finally punting.
